summary: Implement app-wide default date range (current week Monday–Friday) and add Auto Toll functionality in Car Expense menu (toggle + amount input + weekday auto-add).
architectural_notes: Date range components across the app should default to the current week (Mon–Fri) consistently.
Auto Toll is configured in Car Expense menu; when enabled, a weekday scheduler/trigger should auto-create daily toll expense entries using the configured amount.

existing_features.title: Update the app’s default date range selection so that on initial load it is always set to the current week from Monday through Friday (inclusive), matching the date-range UI shown in the provided screenshot. This default must apply everywhere in the app where a date range is displayed/used.

Add an "Auto Toll Add" toggle control inside the Car Expense menu/panel. When enabled, it turns on the automatic toll creation behavior described in REQ-4; when disabled, no automatic toll entries are created.

Add a toll amount input beside the "Auto Toll Add" toggle in the Car Expense menu/panel. The amount input must be editable only when Auto Toll is OFF; when Auto Toll is ON, the input becomes read-only and the auto-added toll expense amount uses this value.

When "Auto Toll Add" is ON, automatically add a Toll car expense entry for each weekday (Monday–Friday) using the configured toll amount. The system must avoid creating duplicate auto-added toll entries for the same date.

new_feature_requests.summary: Set default date range everywhere in the app to current week Monday–Friday
Add 'Auto Toll Add' toggle in Car Expense menu to auto-create a toll expense entry each weekday when enabled
Add toll amount input next to Auto Toll toggle; editable only when toggle is OFF and read-only when ON; auto-added toll uses this amount

projectName: App-wide current-week (Mon–Fri) default date range + Auto Toll Add in Car Expense
